website_summaries.verdict: Designed for shaping wood, you will find a lot of uses for the practical half hatchet.
pros: A reliable hatchet by a company that has been around for a long time
Good for camping and outdoor needs
cons: The quality on this hatchet might not be good enough for professional work

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the best Hatchet but this is the best Hatchet for the price, I don't use it for woodworking or carpentry but for axe throwing. I have thrown this thing in many times and haven't broken it yet, I believe that's a fair judgement on how durable it is. It has taken many strikes directly into the handle and the handle has yet to crack or break. I did work the edge up a little bit to sharpen it.
customer_reviews.author: Zombie Slayer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe i just got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: i got this specifically for axe throwing. i received it in the mail today and immediately took it into the back yard to throw. man did it throw great, however after only a handful of throws i noticed the handle was really loose in the head. this particular axe has the handle epoxied in. i was able to wiggle the handle out by hand. the handle only goes into the axe about 2/3 the way, the rest of the void in the axe head is filled with epoxy. only about 1/2" of actual wood was bonded to the axe head as well. bummer. will probably try to reinstall the handle with a wedge.
customer_reviews.author: Harper

customer_reviews.title: Love it for throwing
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these for axe throwing and have absolutely no complaints. Since it's not designed for throwing, I had to sharpen it up a bit, but that wasn't a problem. The balance is good--but different than on most axes due to the hammer on the back of the head. The hammer also changes the rotation, so you have to compensate for that. It is heavier than most throwing axes, and the handle is a bit thicker, so you might have to make adjustments--I know some throwers who file the handles down a bit. But the added weight can help cut through knots on the target.
customer_reviews.author: F. Bonacci

customer_reviews.title: Great Axe for Axe Throwing
customer_reviews.text: These Axes/are really nice for Axe throwing. We are armatures that had never thrown axes at a target. Built a target via internet video and 15 of my buddies had a contest. After several throws we where pretty consistent in sticking the axe. The only con to these hatchets are the handles are real smooth probably not a problem if used as intended but can be scary if thrown. I just added some athletic tape to one and a Baseball Bat wrap to the other and problem solved .
customer_reviews.author: Bennett

customer_reviews.title: High quality hatchet cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I hated the finish, so five minutes later with an angle grinder, and this thing is awesome. Completely changed the aesthetic, got it razor sharp, and now I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Beef Gerke

customer_reviews.title: Good throwing axe
customer_reviews.text: Great for throwing. Balanced well was a little heavy for mt daughter ended up gett8ng a 22 oz for her but good for a fit adult.
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Great for axe-throwing
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted, well made, prompt delivery, good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: tlmoore

customer_reviews.title: Weight of the cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way that the cutter edge is a little offset from the main cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great throwing AXE!
customer_reviews.text: Great throwing axe. Did use grinder to smooth out blade. Only con wish handle was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Veitch jeep

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described...
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than expected....need a little sharpening, but a great tool overall!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this with the intention of throwing
customer_reviews.text: Love this axe for throwing. With it being 30 oz, it is a bit too heavy to use for NATF competition but it is fantastic to warm up with before using your regulation axe.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Hennings

customer_reviews.title: Score
customer_reviews.text: I honestly would say bad reviews are for people that just can't throw correctly. Definitely a must-buy
customer_reviews.author: james rabatin

customer_reviews.title: Used for Axe throwing
customer_reviews.text: This product holds up to over 100 Axe throws! Wow Super great product Highly recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: 30 oz weight is perfect for driving concrete nails into tackstrip, used on a daily basis
customer_reviews.author: javier melgarejo

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what my husband wanted to give as a gift and the product was of high quality. Great product/multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Alexandrow

customer_reviews.title: ... it grew legs an walk away off a job great
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these for years yi it grew legs an walk away off a job great tool
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good carpenter's hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I use this hatchet in my shop and as a hatchet when I do Civil War re-enactments. Since I use it for re-enactments I had to sand the handle and head to get rid of all that red. It holds an edge. It sharpens to a good edge. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: RDRR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome axe and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great axe for throwing. You need to learn its balance point, but it’s still going strong, haven’t broken the head yet. So thats a good things. Good flat blade and decent profile.
customer_reviews.author: Shon M.

product_meta.title: Plumb 30 oz. Half Hatchet with Hickory Handle - 11549
product_meta.description:
2472-0047 Features: -Octagon-Shaped Pole. -Hardened, Tempered Bit Holds Sharp Cutting Edge. -Hickory Handle. -30 Oz Head Weight. -Permabond® Construction Between Head And Handle. -Durable, Black Epoxy Finish On Head. Product Type: -Hatchet. Handle: -Wood. Dimensions: Overall Length - Top To Bottom: -6.6". Overall Width - Side To Side: -1.4". Overall Depth - Front To Back: -13.9". Overall Product Weight: -2.2 Lbs.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Plumb 30 oz Hickory Handled Half Hatchet also known as an Octagon Pole Hatchet has a hardened tempered bit that holds a sharp cutting edge. Permabond construction between the hickory handle and the steel head insures a tight and long lasting bond. This is a rugged tool designed for use in trimming and shaping poles, beams and other large pieces of wood.
feature_bullets: Made to withstand even the most demanding jobs
International Renown for our diverse range of products
All our products have been designed with the requirements of the professional in mind
Trusted, designed, and used by experts
